solution_line_template: The twins ordered a cheeseburger each so {num_twins}*{cheeseburger_price} = $<<{num_twins}*{cheeseburger_price}={twins_cheeseburgers_total}>>{twins_cheeseburgers_total} for both cheeseburgers
Everyone ordered a dessert so {num_people}*{dessert_price} = $<<{num_people}*{dessert_price}={dessert_total}>>{dessert_total} for dessert

When you add all the meals together they spent {mom_lobster_price}+{dad_steak_price}+{twins_cheeseburgers_total}+{appetizer_price}+{dessert_total} = $<<{mom_lobster_price}+{dad_steak_price}+{twins_cheeseburgers_total}+{appetizer_price}+{dessert_total}={meals_total}>>{meals_total}
When you add up the meals ${meals_total} and Zach's tip of ${tip_amount} then the total cost is {meals_total} + {tip_amount} = $<<{meals_total}+{tip_amount}={final_total}>>{final_total}
